intro: Nitrosalsola subglabra, commonly known as the smooth nitrosalsola, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sandy habitats and is known for its small, yellowish flowers. It has smooth, glabrous leaves and is often found in coastal or inland regions with well-drained soils. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and ecological researchers.
